{"step_by_step_thinking": "Class 3 hemorrhagic shock refers to a specific level of blood loss. To determine the correct answer, we need to understand the classification of hemorrhagic shock. Hemorrhagic shock is classified into four classes based on the percentage of blood loss. Class 1 refers to blood loss less than 15%, Class 2 refers to blood loss between 15% - 30%, Class 3 refers to blood loss between 30% - 40%, and Class 4 refers to blood loss more than 40%.
